snippet: The recent violence in Paris and Beirut and the downing of a Russian passenger jet appear to be part of a centrally planned campaign of attacks by an evolving Islamic State.
abstract: Terrorist attacks in Paris, in combination with attacks in Beirut, Lebanon and Egypt, show Islamic State has evolved from past focus on its territorial holdings in Iraq and Syria; group's expanded organizational ability and reach into distant lands has forced American and European counterterrorism officials to recalibrate their efforts to fight militants.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington and David D. Kirkpatrick from London. Katrin Bennhold and Adam Nossiter contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The recent violence in Paris and Beirut and the downing of a Russian passenger jet appear to be part of a centrally planned campaign of attacks by an evolving Islamic State.

headline.main: Strategy Shift for ISIS: Inflicting Terror in Distant Lands
headline.print_headline: Strategy Shift for ISIS: Inflicting Terror in Distant Lands

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
